    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ClipInBucket(Task task)
      Construct a bucket attached to the specified task

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void empty()
      Removes and finalizes all the clip-ins currently in the bucket.
      ClipInBucket extract(Node node)
      Extracts a copy of the clip-in bucket for attaching to the data being output from the task, finializing all the clip-ins in the extracted bucket This method is called when data is output by a unit.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClipInBucket

        public ClipInBucket(Task task)
        Construct a bucket attached to the specified task

    • Method Detail

      • getTask

        public Task getTask()
        Returns:
        the task this bucket is attached to

      • isAttached

        public boolean isAttached()
        Returns:
        true if this bucket is attached to a task

      • insert

        public void insert(ClipInBucket insert,
          Node node)
        Inserts the clip-ins in the specified clip-in bucket into this bucket, intializing all the clip-ins in the insertion bucket. This method is called when data is input by a unit.
        Parameters:
        insert - the clip-ins to be inserted into the bucket
        node - the node the data arrived on

      • extract

        public ClipInBucket extract(Node node)
        Extracts a copy of the clip-in bucket for attaching to the data being output from the task, finializing all the clip-ins in the extracted bucket This method is called when data is output by a unit.
        Parameters:
        node - the node the data is being output from

      • empty

        public void empty()
        Removes and finalizes all the clip-ins currently in the bucket. This method is usually called after a unit has finished processing

      • putClipIn

        public void putClipIn(java.lang.String name,
             java.lang.Object clipin)
        Puts the specified clip-in into the bucket, initializing the clip-in being inserted. If there is already a clip-in for the specified name then that clip-in is finialized and removed.

      • removeClipIn

        public java.lang.Object removeClipIn(java.lang.String name)
        Removes the clip-in for the specified name from the bucket. The clip-in being removed is finalized.
        Returns:
        the removed clip-in (or null if unknown)

      • getClipIn

        public java.lang.Object getClipIn(java.lang.String name)
        Returns:
        the clip-in with the specified name, or null if none exists. If the clip-in object is an instance of the ClipIn interface then a finalized copy is returned.

      • getClipInNames

        public java.lang.String[] getClipInNames()
        Returns:
        an array of names of the clip-ins stored in this

      • isClipInName

        public boolean isClipInName(java.lang.String name)
        Returns:
        true if a clip-in with the specified name exists in the bucket

      • extractClipInStore

        public ClipInStore extractClipInStore()
        Returns:
        a store of the current clipin bucket state

      • restoreClipInStore

        public void restoreClipInStore(ClipInStore store)
        Restores the state stored in a clip-in store
